column4: I've installed Ubuntu 8.04 on a system that does not have internet access.  I would like to know how I would go about downloading packages and updates to put on a CD and then bring them to the other computer to install them.  I'm particularly interested in installing the Nvidia drivers and multimedia support.  I have already looked at AptOnCD, but it doesn't include any of the restricted packages I'm most interested in.
Yes we did .. more than once
It's been changed.
Did you even look at what aptoncd is?
Yes.  I've looked at it before and I have it open right now as well.  It does not have the packages I'm looking for.
You build it with the packages you download.
burn /var/cache/apt/archives to a cd or dvd
Then why is nvidia-glx-new and all the multimedia codecs not there?  Those are the only packages I really urgently wanted to get.
You are not understanding what aptoncd is..
It will allow me to create a cd of all the packages I've downloaded using Apt of Synaptic, right?
yes

Well, I didn't use apt or synaptic to install them (they were automatically installed either with "Hardware Drivers" or when I tried to play a restricted format.  Whether those programs use apt or not, those packages are NOT in /var/cache/apt/archives
basically everything in /var/cache/apt/archives along with a reference file for the mirror/repo
It does packages that you downloaded...
I understand that.  But the packages are NOT there... lol.  I don't know how to be any more clear, I'm sorry.
I have no interest..
Then don't consider me an idiot.  I asked how to do it without APTonCD and you refused to answer.
Tone down the attitude
it is supposed to work.. yes
THanks
Edit fstab to mount your drive every boot
